order_book.pipeline_commentary: Healthy deal pipeline; momentum in large deal space continues. Intensely competitive deal advisor led deal win in insurance, TCV $44M. Cloud-led infrastructure transformation and insurance domain expertise key differentiators. Two deal wins in wealth management: one with leading investment management company using AI and automation, and another with global bank for multi-year cloud-based transformation. DT chose LTI as strategic partner for setting up and running Microsoft Cloud Acceleration Centre. Guidewire recognized LTI as consulting alliance partner.

financial_analysis.performance_summary: LTIM reported Q1 FY2020 revenue of $356.5M (INR 24,849M), up 0.8% QoQ and 11.5% YoY (12.9% YoY in CC). Digital revenue reached 39% of total revenue, growing 27.5% YoY.  EBIT margin was 16%, down from 17.7% in Q4 FY2019, impacted by visa costs, sales & marketing investments, and currency movements. PAT margin stood at 14.3%.  Growth was challenged by reduced spending at a top account and completion of a separation program at a large African banking client.  Despite these challenges, the company secured a $44M TCV deal in insurance and made progress in strategic partnerships and acquisitions. Management expects positive sequential growth in Q2 and accelerated growth from Q3 onwards, driven by large deal ramp-ups and a healthy pipeline.

latest_quarter.narrative: Q1 FY2020 showed mixed performance. While USD revenue grew marginally by 0.8% QoQ and 11.5% YoY, CC revenue growth was stronger at 1% QoQ and 12.9% YoY. EBIT margin declined to 16% from 17.7% in the previous quarter, primarily due to increased visa costs, higher sales and marketing investments, and currency fluctuations. PAT margin also decreased to 14.3% from 15.2% QoQ. CPG, Retail, and Pharma continued strong momentum with 6.2% QoQ growth. Hi-Tech and Media saw moderated growth of 1.6% QoQ after a strong Q4.
